intro: Alnus jorullensis var. typica, commonly known as the Jorullén alder, is a shrub or small tree native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Betulaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and catkin-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and limestone areas, adapting to the island's unique climate. It plays a role in stabilizing soils and supporting local biodiversity. Its ecological significance is notable in the endemic flora of the Canary Islands.
